Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent of the exception granted to Congress by President Obama.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or support to prove that President Obama granted all of Congress an exception to Obamacare.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that President Obama granted Congress an exception to Obamacare based on the requests of Harry Reid and Senate Democrats.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided that Congress does not receive an exception to Obamacare, but rather faces a specific provision that requires them to obtain healthcare through the marketplaces.
